HSSE – Real-Time Safety Data Fabric
The Edge Data & Connectivity layer forms the real-time data fabric for HSSE systems in remote or hazardous sites.
It integrates data streams from gas detectors, thermal cameras, PPE sensors, and fire detection units through standardized edge interfaces.
Using secure, low-latency protocols, the system aggregates and transmits safety telemetry to local and central dashboards, ensuring immediate event propagation and auditability.
Even during network disruptions, edge-level caching and redundancy ensure safety-critical data is preserved and transmitted once links are restored, improving responsiveness and compliance tracking.
Direct Air Capture (DAC) Process Connectivity
In Direct Air Capture units, Edge Data & Connectivity supports continuous, high-resolution data collection from different sensors.
Edge devices standardize and synchronize these data streams using industrial protocols for integration into local control systems and enterprise analytics.
By applying data filtering, compression, and buffering, the platform ensures bandwidth-efficient, lossless data transmission to cloud systems.
Resilient Ethernet links connect DAC units to supervisory control centers, enabling stable monitoring and optimization of CO₂ capture operations
Marine and Offshore Operations Connectivity
For offshore vessels and marine assets, the Edge Data & Connectivity layer ensures secure and continuous telemetry exchange between navigation, radar, and engine health monitoring systems.
Edge gateways onboard ships aggregate and compress data streams from multiple subsystems and synchronize them through satellite and 5G maritime networks.
This multi-network strategy provides redundant connectivity, enabling operators to maintain situational awareness and equipment diagnostics in bandwidth-limited environments.
